fields.title: Rice farmer in Vietnam
fields.description: In Vietnam, Oxfam's focus is on education, sustainable livelihoods, Fair Trade, gender equality, and disaster preparedness.

fields.title: A group of children in Cambodia
fields.description: A group of children in Cambodia gather and smile for the camera.

fields.title: Combating drought in the Horn of Africa
fields.description: Mary Atabo's family used to own over 100 goats but now have only 10 due to the drought.

fields.title: Aid reaching Pakistan
fields.description: Household water treatment using PUR sachets for clearing dirty water and making it safe for drinking at household level. One sachet of PUR treats about 10 litre of water in about 30 minutes.

fields.title: Humanitarian Crisis In Gaza
fields.description: A Palestinian girl, who fled with her family from their house, looks out the window at a United Nations aid center in a school in Rafah in the southern Gaza Strip.

fields.title: Each expressing their own style!
fields.description: At this year's festivals Oxfam campaigners are asking you to paint your face blue and join the growing global movement of people determined to take action on climate change. If you have taken part, search for your picture in the gallery.

fields.title: Pakistan floods
fields.description: Hundreds of families have had to evacuate their homes after flooding in Pakistan.

fields.title: Stunning photos in Azerbaijan
fields.description: A young boy collects water in Dargalar village in Azerbaijan. The village had been without drinkable water for over two years prior.

fields.title: Rice fields in Malawi
fields.description: Leyla working in her rice field. Oxfam has been funding an irrigation scheme in Malawi that has helped improve the lives of 400 families by transforming their low-yield crops into year-round, high volume harvests that provide food and a continuous source of income.

fields.title: Hair styling in Kenya
fields.description: he pastoralist communities of Turkana are experiencing the longest period of drought in their history. These women gather in the shade to talk and get their hair styled.

fields.title: Flooding crisis in Pakistan
fields.description: A man tries to cross a make-shift bridge to escape his flooded home in Nowshera on 31 July, 2010. Heavy monsoon rains have triggered the worst floods in decades in Pakistan's northwest, forcing thousands of people from their homes as authorities struggle to reach stranded villagers.

fields.title: Farmers in Ghana
fields.description: Farmers in Astuare Region, Ghana. Oxfam's work in Ghana has focused on sustainable agricultural livelihoods and free universal quality health care.

fields.title: Big fish in Kenya
fields.description: Achim Cheme, carrying a fish on her head. In 2011 Oxfam launched its biggest ever appeal for those affected by the East Africa food crisis. Oxfam is helping families in Ethiopia, Somalia and Kenya get the food, water and basic sanitation they desperately need to stay alive.

fields.title: Schools in Gao
fields.description: New wells have been installed and teacher training courses have improved standards of teaching. Fatimata is just one of the thousands of children who are not yet in school. This year, with your help, we can get 10,300 more children into school and out of poverty.

fields.title: Children going to school in Gao
fields.description: Children on their way to school in one of the many small settlements in Gao, Mali. Most children in Mali struggle to get an education. Oxfam is helping some of the poorest communities by building and repairing schools, providing school equipment, and running teacher training courses.

fields.title: Education in Mali
fields.description: Mouna was one of the first girls in her village to go to school. With an education, Mouna has a real chance at a better life. Being able to read and write will give Mouna a route out of poverty and help her to achieve her dream of becoming a teacher.

fields.title: Life in a box
fields.description: A family carries relief supplies, distributed by the Army, on train tracks back to their homes after flood waters receded in Nowshera, located in Pakistan's northwest Khyber-Pakhtunkhwa Province.

fields.title: Refuge campus
fields.description: Children play amidst tents where residents shifted to camps take refuge from heavy floods in Nowshera, located in Pakistan's northwest Khyber-Pakhtunkhwa Province.

fields.title: Emergency boats of Oxfam
fields.description: In Punjab Province, Oxfam has deployed emergency boats to assist government search and rescue efforts. So far we have helped evacuate 80,000 people to safety.

fields.title: Drowned house in Pakistan
fields.description: A woman points towards her flooded home from a hilltop overlooking Nowshera, located in Pakistan's northwest Khyber-Pakhtunkhwa Province on 31 July, 2010. Heavy monsoon rains triggered the worst floods in decades in Pakistan's northwest

fields.title: East Africa
fields.description: Ekorot Eriono shows how dry and infertile the soil is in northern Turkana. Seven years without sufficient rain has left its mark on the landscape and the people.

fields.title: A given water
fields.description: Faadomo Hirsi and her grandson wheel their daily allowance of two 20-litre jerrycans of water back to their house.

fields.title: Waridaad village’s
fields.description: After nearly 11 months without a drop of rain, all of Waridaad village’s traditional water sources dried up. Oxfam partners Havyoco have been trucking in clean water every day. The water is pumped into these community tanks, from where each family queues up to fill their jerrycans.

fields.title: The system's burst
fields.description: Asekon Elailo.---When I wear this dress and I wear my feather it reminds me of the original way of living in Turkana. It makes me think about respect. It was a time when people respected us.

fields.title: World Hunger
fields.description: kai Nayapar--I came here today to see if we could borrow some food from a friend or neighbour. If I get nothing we will have nothing to eat today.
